competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Counseling and Mental Health Services
Describe counseling and mental health services.
Research counseling and mental health services available at the state and local level.
Describe common cause for seeking counseling and mental health services.
Describe a physically healthy environment to enhance effectiveness of treatment.
Plan furniture and d√©cor for a counseling or mental health facility.
Discuss the ethical and legal responsibilities of the counseling services to the client.
Demonstrate an understanding of the counseling and mental health services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the counseling and mental health services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the counseling and mental health services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the counseling and mental health services career pathway.
Research the history of the counseling and mental health services career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the counseling and mental health services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the counseling and mental health services career pathway.
Consumer Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the consumer services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the consumer services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the consumer services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the consumer services career pathway.
Research the history of consumer services career have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the consumer services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the consumer services career pathway.
Identify consumer services.
Examine consumer services laws and ethics required for obtaining licensures.
Discuss client and consumer service skills including ability to empathize and to motivate clients.
Research and recommend products, plans, or services.
Create advertisement documents for specific audiences.
Describe ethical and legal responsibilities associated with providing consumer services to clients and consumers.
Early Childhood Development and Services
Discuss early childhood development and services.
Describe a safe and sanitary learning environment for a child.
Describe the indicators of a healthy child.
Identify common indicators of child abuse and neglect.
Describe common physical, emotional, intellectual, and social milestones for children.
Discuss strategies that promote growth and development.
Create a developmentally appropriate activity to reflect interests and developmental levels.
Arrange learning centers that provide for a child’s exploration, discovery, and development.
Observe and document children’s progress.
Evaluate games, equipment, activities, books, and play materials for age appropriateness.
Demonstrate an understanding of the early childhood development and services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the early childhood development and services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the early childhood development and services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the early childhood development and services career pathway.
Research the history of the early childhood development and services career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the early childhood development and services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the early childhood development and services career pathway.
Demonstrate knowledge, skills and practices of early childhood care.
Identify stages of child development and age appropriate activities.
List the roles and responsibilities of parents and caregivers.
Identify community resources that benefit children, such as first aid and critical emergency skills.
Explore toys, books, games, and software of interest to children.
Demonstrate safe and proper use of toys and equipment, including safe play.
Compare different forms of guidance (e.g. redirection of behavior) used with children in different situations.
Family and Community Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the family and community services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the family and community services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the family and community services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the family and community services career pathway.
Research the history of the family and community services career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the family and community services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the family and community services career pathway.
Discuss family and community services.
Research family and community services available through agencies, organizations, and churches at the local and state level.
Create documents to advertise family and community services.
Discuss the ethical and legal responsibilities of the family and community services to the client.
General
Identify and explore careers in the Human Services cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Human Services career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Human Services career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Human Services career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Human Services career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Human Services career cluster.
Research a career in the Human Services career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Human Services career cluster.
Identify career pathways related to family and consumer sciences.
Define and describe the different types of businesses related to family and consumer sciences career pathways.
Explain entrepreneurship.
Describe the risks and advantages of entrepreneurship.
Develop an entrepreneur business plan for a family and consumer sciences career pathway.
Operate an on-site business related to a family and consumer sciences career pathway.
Recognize factors that affect personality development.
Review Robert Havighurst’s developmental tasks of pre-adolescence and adolescence.
Identify Maslow’s basic human needs.
Define self-esteem and self-concept.
Explain how heredity and environment affect the development of personality.
Identify factors that affect self-concept and achievement.
State how a positive self-concept builds good relationships with friends, peers, parents, and family members.
Identify characteristics of individuals with high and low self-esteem.
Inventory personal traits, attitudes, abilities, talents, and values that can be used as resources in personal development.
Analyze personality strengths and weaknesses.
Identify how values and standards affect character and actions.
Determine how to make ethical decisions.
Identify and apply skills needed for positive interpersonal relationships.
Identify social skills that contribute to good relationships with others, including diverse multi-cultural groups.
Identify appropriate topics of conversation when establishing relationships with acquaintances.
List forms of verbal and non-verbal communication.
Practice positive communication skills.
Demonstrate appropriate manners and etiquette for a variety of social situations.
Distinguish between the types of communication (e.g. social media, texting, nonverbal, etc.).
Identify the various types of relationships, such as family, friends, and peers.
Define self-esteem and state how a positive self-concept builds healthy relationships.
Identify common areas of conflict and possible resolutions for healthy relationships.
Identify positive coping skills for adjusting to stress and conflict.
Identify positive and negative stress.
Identify changes that affect families.
Describe ways of coping with personal and family stress and crises.
Recognize signs of peer pressure and bullying.
Demonstrate refusal skills.
Identify causes of conflict.
List the steps in the conflict resolution process.
Compare ways of dealing with and preventing conflict with friends and family members.
Identify relationships that influence personality development.
Identify types of relationships.
Describe qualities of a friend.
Define reasons for dating.
Recognize healthy and unhealthy relationships.
List the functions of families.
List types of family structures.
Describe the family life cycle.
Identify ways to blend work and family.
Discuss the benefits and challenges of current technology and the impact on the family.
Identify factors in caring for children and the elderly.
Discuss the joys and challenges of being a parent.
Recognize the importance of healthy choices as they relate to the well-being of the individual.
Define and describe symptoms of stress.
Identify various coping behaviors.
List and define types of substance abuse.
Identify effects of substance abuse on job performance.
List help that is available, through the government and community organizations, for attaining and maintaining good mental and emotional health.
Describe the importance of healthy food choices as they relate to job performance.
Identify techniques for balancing work, community, and personal life.
Apply  the decision making process to personal finance choices.
Identify needs versus wants.
Research and use various consumer information sources to make purchases (e.g. online versus store front).
Set financial goals, including saving and investing.
Develop a plan for resource management (e.g. develop a plan for managing a budget).
Identify ways to keep personal information safe and utilize consumer safety guidelines.
Identify desirable personal and work ethics.
Describe positive and negative personal and work ethics.
Recognize the benefits of positive personal and work ethics.
Identify character traits that reflect good moral judgment (e.g. honesty, kindness).
Demonstrate characteristics that produce successful employee to employer relations.
Develop interpersonal skills for personal and career success.
Determine ways to strengthen self-esteem.
Identify factors that influence personality formation.
Identify positive human resources required for successful personal and work relationships.
Describe qualities and characteristics of a mentoring experience.
Determine the relevance of integrating academic learning, social skills, and lifestyle choices to home, community, and career.
Demonstrate critical thinking skills and application of the decision making process as it relates to personal and work situations.
Define the decision-making process.
Apply the decision-making process in workplace situations.
Demonstrate the ability to apply critical thinking skills.
Identify appropriate dress for various job experiences.
Practice good grooming techniques.
Identify the factors needed to create an economical, coordinated, easy care work wardrobe.
Select appropriate clothing for a variety of careers and work situations.
Identify legal issues as they relate to the work environment.
Define and describe types of sexual harassment in the workplace.
Identify appropriate conversation for the work environment.
List the advantages of a culturally diverse workplace.
Discuss the Americans with Disabilities Act.
Discuss the Equal Employment Opportunity Act.
Identify job benefits.
Define job benefits.
Identify advantages of fringe benefits.
Discuss income as it relates to career success.
Demonstrate an understanding of food preparation skills and nutrition.
Identify current USDA dietary guidelines to plan daily food choices and maintain wellness.
Interpret and use recipes.
Select, use, care for and store food preparation equipment.
Identify and apply food safety and sanitation practices.
Identify and demonstrate acceptable behaviors for table service and etiquette.
Specify nutritional needs of the young adult.
Demonstrate an understanding of fashion and sewing concepts.
Determine values, needs, and wants related to wardrobe and grooming.
Recognize factors that influence clothing purchases.
Identify sewing tools and techniques.
Use tools and materials to create a personalized individual or group project.
Demonstrate an understanding of housing and interior design.
Identify lifestyle, common needs, common values, and goals related to housing.
Identify elements and principles of design.
Demonstrate ways to create a comfortable living space.
Personal Care Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the personal care services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the personal care services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the personal care services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the personal care services career pathway.
Research the history of personal care services career have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the personal care services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the personal care services career pathway.
Assess the importance of good health and wellness.
Describe wellness.
Explain the importance of good nutrition.
Classify foods according to the Food Guide Pyramid.
List the essential nutrients and describe their functions and sources.
List good health practices that contribute to looking your best.
Identify the health risks associated with the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.
List resources and organizations that assist individuals who abuse alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.
Develop an exercise and nutrition plan that incorporates the components of wellness.
Identify careers related to health and wellness.
Describe personal care services.
Describe and apply principles of biology necessary to select safe and effective personal care products and services.
Explain principles of chemistry in the composition, structure, and properties of processes of a broad-range of personal care products and services.
Apply basic principles of human anatomy necessary in order to determine needed personal care.
Create advertisement documents to attract and retain human services clientele.
Discuss the ethical and legal responsibilities of the personal services provider to the client.
